evolve::StandardCamera

evolve::StandardCamera Class Reference

#include <StandardCamera.h>

Inheritance diagram for evolve::StandardCamera:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Wrapper around ogre camera which methods to make it behave in a "standard" fashion based on the given user input.

"Standard" is defined according to me. It means a mouse motion event (given in x and y) moves where the camera looks. forward/upward/etc should be obvious, except for one caveat: motion is always relative to where the camera is looking (not as in FPS games). If your looking up, and move forward, you move up. mousePressed/mouseReleased is used to track the selection/dropping of objects at a given x/y.

 Returns the name and new position of all previously selected movable objects the name is the same name as given by Ogre::movable->getName() the location is the new location in three space (where it would be "dropped").
